pr_title: Sonarjava 3362 junit5 test class method visibility

timeline.bodyText:
We should add a test to assert that we look at org.junit.jupiter.api.Test and no other annotations.
e.g.:
@org.junit.Test
public void testPublic() {} // Compliant, JUnit 4
timeline.author: alban-auzeill

replies.bodyText: ẁe should add a test with other modifiers (e.g. final or synchronized) to show the rule only target public, private and protected
replies.author: alban-auzeill

timeline.bodyText: The rule target properly METHOD, but for CLASS it's more complicated. A JUnit 5 test class is a class that contains at least one test method. I would probably register only on CLASS, then check all members for test methods. So I could at the same time check if one test method exists and check if each test method is compliant.
timeline.author: alban-auzeill

replies.bodyText: Ah of course, I'm not filtering properly, my bad
replies.author: johann-beleites-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText:
By adding the following constant:
private static final List<Modifier> NON_COMPLIANT_MODIFIERS = Arrays.asList(Modifier.PUBLIC, Modifier.PRIVATE, Modifier.PROTECTED);

we could simplify the implementation like this:
      modifiers.modifiers().stream()
        .filter(modifierKeyword -> NON_COMPLIANT_MODIFIERS.contains(modifierKeyword.modifier()))
        .map(Tree.class::cast)
        .findFirst()
        .ifPresent(modifierKeyword -> reportIssue(modifierKeyword, "Remove this access modifier"));
